intro: Seseli hispidum, commonly known as hairy seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and compound leaves that are often divided into small, lance-shaped segments. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Seseli hispidum is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. It is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
